author: Alex Hoegler
title: Stephen Belichick's Wife Takes A Direct Shot At 24-Year-Old Jordon Hudson With Stern Comment On Social Media Post
text:
Bill Belichick‚Äôs daughter-in-law doesn‚Äôt appear to be a fan of his girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, judging by her telling comment on Instagram.
In case you missed it, Jordon Hudson and Bill Belichick have been the subject of criticism following the UNC football coach‚Äôs bizarre interview with Tony Dokoupil on CBS‚Äôs ‚ÄúSunday Morning‚Äù program.
Belichick was on the show to promote his new book, The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football. The interview quickly turned tense, however, when Hudson shut down a question from Dokoupil about how the couple met:
"We're not talking about this."
‚Äî Complex Sports (@ComplexSports)
Jordon Hudson interrupts Bill Belichick's CBS Sunday interview when he's asked how they met üò≥[pic.twitter.com/LvncZ88UVY][April 27, 2025]
Former New England Patriots stars Julian Edelman and Rob Gronkowski discussed the bizarre interview during the latest episode of their ‚ÄúDudes On Dudes‚Äù podcast. After the clip was posted on the show‚Äôs Instagram page, Nikki Glaser defended Jordon Hudson and said she was simply doing her job as a ‚Äúpublicist.‚Äù
Jennifer Schmitt, who‚Äôs married to Bill Belichick‚Äôs son, Stephen, clapped back at Glasser with a scathing comment. Schmitt wrote, ‚Äúpublicists act in a professional manner and don‚Äôt ‚Äústorm‚Äù off set delaying an interview.‚Äù
You can view her comment below:
Click on ‚ÄòFollow Us‚Äô and get notified of the most viral NFL stories via Google! Follow Us
Well this is interesting and explains a lot about how the Belichick family feels towards Jordon Hudson.
‚Äî Savage (@SavageSports_)
On the comments of a Julian Edelman IG video, Nikki Glaser defends Jordon Hudson.
Steve Belichick‚Äôs wife, Jen, replies ‚Äúpublicists act in a professional manner and don‚Äôt‚Ä¶[pic.twitter.com/NUw4g0MgBG][April 30, 2025]
After the video clip of Hudson shutting down the question went viral, TMZ reported that she ‚Äúgot so heated,‚Äù got ‚Äúup and walked out and wanted BB to follow.‚Äù This caused a delay in the interview and ‚Äúspooked‚Äù Dokoupil, TMZ reported.
Jordon Hudson & Bill Belichick Met On A Flight In 2021
In a statement that he released on Wednesday, Belichick criticized CBS for bringing up his personal life during the interview. Belichick also clarified previous reports that the couple met during a plane ride from Boston to Florida in February 2021, while he was still in a relationship with Linda Holliday.
Belichick and Judson began their romance at some point in 2023, after his 16-year relationship with Holliday ended. There‚Äôs a 49-year age gap between the couple (Belichick 73, Hudson 24).
Also Read: PHOTOS: Bill Belichick‚Äôs GF Jordon Hudson Reveals Her Real Age For The First Time With Custom Bday Gift, And She‚Äôs Even Younger Than We Thought

author: @areanapoliit
title: EUROPA LEAGUE - Lazio-Real Sociedad 3-1. Biancocelesti primi a una giornata dalla fine
text:
EUROPA LEAGUE - Lazio-Real Sociedad 3-1. Biancocelesti primi a una giornata dalla fine
La compagine biancoceleste ha superato la Real Sociedad con il punteggio finale di 3-1 nel match valevole per l'Europa League.
La Lazio di Marco Baroni rafforza il primo posto in Europa League a 90 minuti dalla fine della fase a gironi battendo 3-1 all'Olimpico la Real Sociedad. La marcia dei biancocelesti √® stata finora inarrestabile avendo inanellato finora ben sei vittorie e un pareggio.
La Lazio arrivano all'ultima giornata con tre punti di vantaggio sull'Eintracht Francoforte e l'Athletic Bilbao. Contro i baschi, in dieci dalla mezzora (sull'1-0) per doppia ammonizione di Munoz, sono andati in gol Gila al 5', Zaccagni al 32' e Castellanos al 34'. Nella ripresa, al minuto numero 83 la compagine ospite ha trovato il classico gol della bandiera. In una serata cos√¨ positiva per la Lazio c'√® per√≤ anche una brutta notizia: l'infortunio di Nuno Tavares per un infortunio muscolare.
LAZIO-REAL SOCIEDAD 3-1
LAZIO (4-2-3-1): Mandas; Marusic, Gila, Romagnoli, Nuno Tavares (43' Dele-Bashiru); Guendouzi, Rovella; Isaksen (56' Tchaouna), Dia (76' Balde), Zaccagni (56' Noslin); Castellanos (46' Pedro). All. Baroni.
REAL SOCIEDAD (4-1-4-1): Remiro; Aramburu, Aguerd (71' Pacheco), Zubeldia, Munoz; Zubimendi (46' Elustondo); Kubo (46' Barrenetxea), Sucic, Brais Mendez (36' Javi Lopez), Becker; Oyarzabal (46' Marin). All. Alguacil.
Arbitro: Visser (Belgio)
Marcatori: 5' Gila, 32' Zaccagni, 34' Castellanos, 83' Barrenetxea
Ammoniti: Rovella (L), Zubimendi (R) Zaccagni (L)
Espulsi: Munoz al 30' (R) per doppia ammonizione.
Francesco Manno
Giornalista pubblicista dal 2006, √® laureato in scienze della comunicazione. Ha vinto l'Oscar Campano per la sua professionalit√†. Ha inoltre condotto e diretto diversi programmi radio e TV.

author: By
title: Avera Medical Minute: Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month
text:
SIOUX FALLS, S.D. (Dakota News Now) - March is Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month. While it is the third leading cancer in the United States, many are still reluctant to get their screening which is encouraged at age 45. Dr. Cristina Hill Jensen, a board-certified gastroenterologist, explained some of the things to be aware of and prepare for. ‚ÄúI typically will tell patients to avoid some of the higher fiber foods for a few days prior to the procedure,‚Äù Dr. Hill Jensen said. ‚ÄúThe day prior to the procedure is a clear liquid diet, so no food at all.‚Äù Dr. Hill Jensen also tells patients to avoid red or purple drinks to avoid confusion of blood in a stool sample. The preparation and actual procedure can make for a long day, but Dr. Hill Jensen says the procedure is much easier than the prep. The reason is they do not want to miss any type of color or polyps. When the procedure is complete, typically a patient will wake up within 5-10 minutes, have a small snack, and make sure everything is copacetic moving forward.

author: Priscilla Alvarez and Michael Williams, CNN
title: Justice Department says new Texas immigration law violates Constitution
text:
Washington (CNN) ‚Äî A new law that gives local law enforcement in Texas the authority to arrest migrants ‚Äúviolates the US Constitution,‚Äù the Department of Justice said in a letter to Gov. Greg Abbott on Thursday, threatening to sue unless Abbott backs down from enforcing it.
The letter, obtained by CNN, marks the latest escalation between President Joe Biden and Abbott over the handling of the US-Mexico border.
Earlier this month, Abbott, a Republican, signed into law the measure, known as
Senate Bill 4, which gives local law enforcement the power to arrest migrants and gives judges the ability to issue orders to remove people from the United States. The White House slammed the law, calling it ‚Äúincredibly extreme.‚Äù It‚Äôs expected to take effect in March.
Principal deputy assistant attorney general Brian Boynton said in his letter to Abbott Thursday that ‚Äúthe United States intends to file suit to enjoin the enforcement of SB 4 unless Texas agrees to refrain from enforcing the law.‚Äù
While the federal government is ‚Äúcommitted to ‚Ä¶ securing the border,‚Äù Boynton wrote, the Texas law is ‚Äúcontrary to these goals.‚Äù
The ongoing surge of migrants at the US-Mexico border has placed immense pressure on local and federal resources. Thursday‚Äôs legal threat follows a DOJ lawsuit against Texas earlier this year over the state‚Äôs use of
floating barriers in the Rio Grande. That lawsuit is still making its way through the courts.
The enforcement of immigration law is a federal responsibility, and opponents of the Texas measure argue it‚Äôs unconstitutional.
The law has sent ripples of fear throughout the Latino community in Texas, which makes up
40% of the state‚Äôs population. Civil-rights groups, including the American Civil Liberties Union, filed a lawsuit seeking to block the measure.
The Justice Department‚Äôs threat to sue comes on the heels of a
high-levels talks between senior US and Mexican officials this week
Officials from both countries described talks as productive, and Mexican officials are
expected to visit Washington next month to continue the discussions.
The-CNN-Wire
